page.title: 03Framingham Earl Agriculture
page.content: The land outside the 3 villages is all nearly farmland owned by a few large farms.Church Farm,the farmer has owned this land for 10 years.His family were not farmers traditionally,but market gardeners.His farm has 107 acres of land upon which he grows food to supply the shops in bulk.He has 7 acres of grassland where he grazes his cattle,which he breeds for meat not milk.He buys calves in February and fattens them up.His main interests are working on his farm and swimming in his pool.He gets up at about 4.00 a.m and sometimes finishes work at about 12.00 p.m.Each year he has 15 acres of manure to use.He uses irrigation, usually with 4 different crops such as Barley,Beetroot,Wheat and Cabbage.He has to spray all his crops with fungicide to kill insects and also weeds.
